content.description: This is a short trad climb. Even though this is a 5.4ish this isn't a good lead climb if you are just starting out leading and are looking to climb a lead at this level.
content.protection: Lots of places to put pro in but you really don't want to fall on this climb. There is a ring anchor at the top of the climb. Note: There is no access to the ring anchor from the top of the slab. Will need to lead Big Pine Crack or Undercling Thing to get to the ring anchor.

content.description: Look for a bowl on the face and go right through the middle of the bowl when climbing up to the ring anchor.
content.protection: This climb is top rope only and is a bit dirty.  Can lead Beeline Crack to get to the ring anchor for The Bowl.
content.location: The Bowl starts just to the right of Undercling Thing.

content.description: Look for the bolts and lead up to the ring anchor.
content.protection: Quickdraws, cam(s) (1"-2") to place in the horizontal crack above the last bolt. Same ring anchor is used for both Big Pine Crack and Undercling Thing.

content.description:
The crux on this climb is right at the start. If you step on the tree at the bottom to start the climb then it isn't 5.9.

After you get past the start the rest of the climb is 5.4 but it is dirty. This is where you will need a couple of 3.5" cams since the crack gets shallow and wider.

Go straight up the crack and when the crack runs out look for ring anchors off to your left. Best part is the start and that is about it.
content.location: Two sets of ring anchors. Can climb two climbs on each set of ring anchors. Mixture of trad, sport and top rope.
